title: 5 Ways Dancing Makes a Difference for Those with Dementia
excerpt: Dance and movement therapy are the most recent additions to the robust creative arts therapy program across United Hebrew’s campus.

title: ‘You Saved My Life!’  Elvira Mezzaucella’s Heartfelt Thank You
excerpt: Read the remarkable story of this rehabilitation patient, who says she wouldn’t be here if it weren’t for United Hebrew’s “heroic and well-trained staff.”

title: Secrets to a Long Life, from Our Awesome Centenarians
excerpt: There may be more than one pathway to reach age 100, but three women who have passed that milestone have a few key things in common.

title: Is it Aging, Dementia, or Alzheimer’s Disease? Know the Signs
excerpt: While our brains slow with age, memory loss is not a normal part of the aging process. Know the signs of Alzheimer’s and what to do.

title: Benefits of Joining an Alzheimer’s Caregiver Support Group
excerpt: Caring for a loved one who has Alzheimer’s or dementia can leave caregivers exhausted, overwhelmed, and isolated. But you don’t have to go it alone.

title: 5 Signs That Your Aging Parents Need More Care
excerpt: Holidays, birthdays, and family milestones are a time for togetherness and celebration. They’re also an opportunity for adult children to observe Mom or Dad.

title: Rita Mabli Honored as 2016 ‘Woman in Business’ by 914Inc. Magazine
excerpt: United Hebrew President & CEO, Rita Mabli, was recognized as one of Westchester County’s most successful businesswomen by 914Inc. Magazine.

title: United Hebrew Holidays: Celebrating the Spirit of the Season
excerpt: Twinkling lights, joyful voices raised in song, and the aroma of traditional treats are some of the signs that the holidays have arrived at United Hebrew of New Rochelle.

title: 8 Great Holiday Gifts for the Seniors on Your List
excerpt: From health sensors and e-readers to GPS shoes, an array of gadgets, apps, and devices can add convenience, safety and fun to your loved one’s life.

title: United Hebrew Named to List of ‘Best Nursing Homes’ in Nation
excerpt: For the sixth straight year, United Hebrew of New Rochelle has been named to the U.S. News & World Report list of ‘Best Nursing Homes.’

title: How to Choose a Short Term Rehabilitation Facility After a Hospital Stay
excerpt: Whether your hospital stay was unexpected, or occurred after a long-planned surgery, choosing a rehab facility can seem overwhelming.

title: 6 Tips for Managing Sandwich Generation Stress
excerpt: For those in the sandwich generation—adults caring for children and their aging parents—the daily juggling act can be stressful. Here are some tips to help manage.

title: Exercise Each Day to Prevent Alzheimer’s and Dementia
excerpt: New research shows that exercise can help your brain grow, enhance cognitive function, and prevent Alzheimer’s and dementia. And we’re not even talking about long hours of grueling workouts!

title: Seniors and Students Benefit from Exchange of Culture and Caring
excerpt: United Hebrew works with volunteers of all ages from all over Westchester County; recently, our skilled nursing facility received help from a group of volunteers from halfway around the world.

title: United Hebrew Awarded Five-Star Rating for Fifth Consecutive Year
excerpt: Our skilled nursing home and rehabilitation center has received five out of five stars for overall quality by the U.S. Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services, and received additional national recognition for superior care.

title: Willow Gardens: Westchester’s Newest Memory Care Residence
excerpt: Willow Gardens Memory Care is Westchester’s only nonprofit assisted living residence devoted exclusively to caring for those with Alzheimer’s and related dementias. We invite you to take a tour of our newest facility.
